definitions.definition: A submarine sandwich: a sandwich made on a long bun.
definitions.example: We can get subs at that deli.
She worked as a sub until she got her teaching certificate.

definitions.definition: (often in plural) A subscription: a payment made for membership of a club, etc.

definitions.example: I've just noticed a mistake in the subs for this film.

definitions.definition: A subroutine (sometimes one that does not return a value, as distinguished from a function, which does).
A subscription (or (by extension) a subscriber) to an online channel or feed.
definitions.example: I'm totally stoked; just got 10 new subs after my last video.

definitions.definition: Subsistence money: part of a worker's wages paid before the work is finished.
To work as a substitute teacher, especially in primary and secondary education.
To replace (a player) with a substitute.
definitions.example: He never really made a contribution to the match, so it was no surprise when he was subbed at half time.

definitions.definition: Less commonly, and often as sub on, to bring on (a player) as a substitute.
definitions.example: He was subbed on half way through the second half, and scored within minutes.

definitions.definition: To perform the work of a subeditor or copy editor; to subedit.
To coat with a layer of adhering material; to planarize by means of such a coating.
To prepare (a slide) with a layer of transparent substance to support and/or fix the sample.
